column4: can anyone help me?? I'm pulling my hair out here... I've been trying to install Ubuntu 8.10 64bit Desktop edition for 3 days now! It's continuously giving me the following error: [Errno 5] Input/output error
Anyone have experience with this error: [Errno 5] Input/output error ????
from installing 8.10 desktop 64bit
running from live cd
partitions get built, files start copying and it stops at 66% and gives this error
same error this guy got: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=600126 <- but none of the solutions in here work for me
yea, tried 2 different cds, a dvd and a usb stick
all the same
tried different ram even
is that your initial post?
did you md5 check your iso as well as verify the cd was ok once burned and booted to?
haven't done the md5 check yet, but downloaded from official website 2 different times on 2 different cds
doesnt matter
you could pull it down a million times and never get a good image

md5 check the iso you downloaded as well as check the cds are ok. Once we know its not those at fault you can progress, if you have bad disks in your hands you will have a tonne of issues due to incorrect data on the disks
you shouold have checked it as soon as you downloaded it
before you did anything
you were right, md5 was incorrect, cheers for the time and effort
i will reitterate
ALWAYS check MD%
ive seen a tonne of users coming in moaning about bad installs and its nearly always MD5
if you download ANY large image file and there is an MD5, get that too and check what you have
then check the disk is consistant on the first boot screen to check the burn succeeded
